Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text (9 ll.) and Greek docket (3 ll.) on recto and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale of one tenth of an arura of land in Pathuris granted by two officials of the temple to Phile son of Tazarios. Scribe Thotortais son of Nechtminis. Date. year 10 Mesore 15 of Ptol. Philometor = BC. 171 Sep. 14. The Greek docket bears date one day later".
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Ed. in S. E. Thomas Cambridge PhD diss. Text 5 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (329) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/329)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, delaminating Black ink (loss) Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window verso Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
